Rule Code Program statement
Title

Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was previously placed at facility between 3/09/23 and
11/04/23. On an unknown date, youth was found naked and
screaming. It is alleged that a staff member molested the youth.
There were two staff members present with the youth when they
were naked.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed via teams meeting on 2/7/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported she was
“almost touched” on two incidents by staff at the facility. Youth A
2

reported the first incident was in the bathroom by Staff 1. Youth A
did not recall when the incident happened. Youth A reported she
was having suicidal thoughts and told Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3
she was going into the bathroom to self-harm by cutting. Youth A
ran into the bathroom and Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 followed
telling Youth A they could not allow her to self-harm. Youth A
reported she took her clothes off and was just in her bra and
underwear as she knows staff cannot restrain her if she is naked.
Youth A went into the shower area and was sitting in the corner.
Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 were in the bathroom with Youth A.
Staff 1 turned on the cold shower water and was spraying Youth A
with the water. Youth A reported she got mad due to Staff 1
getting her wet and stood up and began threatening Staff 1, Staff
2, and Staff 3. Youth A reported Staff 1 did not spray her with the
water for long as she stood up to fight Staff 1. Youth A went to
swing/hit Staff 1 and Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 backed up. Staff
3 left the bathroom. Youth A sat back down in the corner. Staff 1
walked toward Youth A in the corner and reached down and touch
Youth A’s underwear band with one of her hands. Youth A
reported Staff 1 was going to pull her underwear off, and she got
mad and stood up to fight Staff 1. Youth A began swinging at
Staff 1. Staff 1 and Staff 2 attempted to restrain Youth A; Youth A
was resisting the restraint. Youth A reported Staff 1 and Staff 2
were able to restrain her, and she calmed down after the restraint.
Youth A reported when Staff 1 and Staff 2 restrained her they put
a spit mask on her as she was threatening to spit on them. Youth
A reported she bite through the spit mask and so it was taken off.
Youth A reported there was a blanket over her in the restraint as
she was in her underwear and bra. Youth A reported she did not
know why Staff 1 would try to pull her underwear down. Staff 1
did not say anything other than “I am tired of you”. Youth A
reported once she was calm in the restraint, she was released.
The second incident Youth A did not recall when it occurred but
reported Staff 4 walked into the bathroom on her. Youth A woke
up in the middle of the night and went to the bathroom. Youth A
was in a bathroom stall and heard someone coming. Staff 4 came
into the bathroom and pushed open the bathroom stall door.
Youth A reported she jumped up off the toilet and pulled her pants
up and did not let Staff 4 into the bathroom stall. Youth A left the
bathroom and pushed past Staff 4. Youth A reported the only
thing Staff 4 said was “we don’t speak of it”. Youth A went back to
her bedroom. Youth A reported Staff 4 never said anything else to
her after this. Youth A reported Staff 4 never touched her
inappropriately. Youth A reported no staff at the facility ever
touched her breast, vagina, or butt. Youth A did not have any
other concerns.
3

Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 3/6/2024. Staff 1
reported she worked at Vassar house and recalls Youth A. Staff 1
recalled when Youth A was in her shorts, bra, and socks. The
incident started due to Youth A wanting to leave the facility with
another youth. Staff 1, Staff 3, and other staff, which Staff 1 could
not recall who, were circled around Youth A near the shoe cubby
area using proximity control to keep Youth A inside the unit.
Youth A was screaming that she was being “raped”. Staff 1
reported no staff were touching Youth A when Youth A was
screaming she was being “raped”. Youth A began taking her
clothing off at this time. The male staff who were present, Staff 1
could not recall specifically who, left the area due to Youth A
taking her clothing off. Youth A was only in her bra, shorts and
socks. Youth A ran to the bathroom and Staff 3 followed Youth A
into the bathroom. Staff 1 went and stood in the bathroom
doorway to have a second pair of eyes on Youth A and Staff 3.
Staff 1 reported she did not enter the bathroom as Youth A had
assaulted her prior to the incident by breaking a piece of glass on
her face so Staff 1 was keeping her distance from Youth A as she
felt she was a trigger for Youth A at the time. Staff 1 was in the
doorway of the bathroom and Youth A was climbing under and on
the bathroom stalls. Staff 3 was attempting to redirect Youth A
telling Youth A she was not being safe. Staff 1 was then switched
out by another staff who came to assist Staff 3, Staff 1 did not
recall which staff switched her out. Staff 1 went outside the unit
with a youth who was outside who Youth A was trying to leave the
facility with. Staff 1 and the other youth came back into the
building and Youth A and the other youth were refusing to go to
school and began destroying the hallway by ripping papers off the
wall. Staff 1 denied ever spraying Youth A with water in the
bathroom and stated she was in the doorway the entire time she
was observing and was only observing for approximately one
minute prior to being switched out with another staff. Youth A was
not making any statements while in the bathroom of being “raped”
or “sexually assaulted”. Youth A was not sprayed with water by
any staff while in the bathroom. Staff 1 reported Youth A had
sprayed staff on other occasions with a spray bottle however did
not recall if Youth A was spraying staff during this incident. Youth
A was not restrained or attempted to be restrained while in the
bathroom. Staff 1 reported Youth A was not doing anything that
would warrant a restraint. Staff 1 reported Youth A never
attempted to hit her while she was in the bathroom doorway. Staff
1 denied ever touching Youth A’s underwear band or shorts band.
Staff 1 denied every making a statement to Youth A regarding “I’m
tired of you”. Staff 1 denied a spit mask being used during this
4

incident and reported the facility had removed all spit masks as
they were no longer using spit masks. Staff 1 did not recall a time
she was ever in the bathroom with Youth A, Staff 2, and Staff 3.
Staff 1 reported she was not aware of any times Staff 4 would
have worked a shift alone at the facility on a unit as he is a male
and males are never scheduled to work alone on a female unit.
Staff 1 reported no concerns with Staff 4 ever being inappropriate
with youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 3/6/2024. Staff 2
reported she recalled working with Youth A once when Youth A
removed her shirt and was in a bra and shorts in the bathroom.
Staff 2 could not recall any details of the situation other than Youth
A was trying to stand on the bathroom stall walls. Staff 2 did not
recall which other staff were present. Staff 2 reported she does
not recall ever working with both Staff 1 and Staff 3 as Staff 3 was
an overnight worker and Staff 1 and Staff 2 worked afternoon shift.
Staff 2 reported Youth A was never restrained or attempted to be
restrained by her in the bathroom. Staff 2 reported the bathroom
is not an area where a restraint would occur as there is not
enough room. Staff 2 denied ever seeing Staff 1 touch Youth A
other than possibly in a restraint however Staff 2 was unable to
recall if she had ever seen Staff 1 restrain Youth A. Staff 2 denied
ever seeing any staff turn the shower on Youth A and reported the
shower is not a removeable shower head and there would be no
possible way for someone to spray another person with the
shower. Staff 2 never heard Youth A make any statements about
Staff 1 raping or being sexually inappropriate with her. Staff 2 had
no concerns with Staff 1’s interactions with youth or Youth A. Staff
2 denied ever hearing Staff 1 make any comment to Youth A
regarding “I’m tired of you”. Staff 2 reported she did not recall a
time where Youth A had a spit mask on and stated spit masks are
no longer used at the facility and have not been for a long time.
Staff 2 did not recall when the facility stopped using spit masks.
Staff 2 reported no knowledge of Staff 4 ever working alone on the
unit. The facility does not allow staff to work alone. Staff 4 would
cover breaks for staff however there was always a second staff on
with Staff 4 when he would cover breaks. Staff 2 did not have any
concerns with Staff 4 and his interactions with any youth at the
facility.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on 2/15/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 is a youth specialist
supervisor and worked at Vassar house until approximately April
2023. Youth A removed her clothing at least twice while Staff 3
was working at the facility. Youth A would remove her clothing
5

down to her underwear and run into the bathroom. Staff 3
reported never working with Staff 1 when Youth A removed her
clothing. Staff 3 reported she works third shift and Staff 1 does not
work third shift. Staff 3 never heard anything about Staff 1 sexually
assaulting Youth A. Staff 3 reported the situations where she was
working, and Youth A removed her clothing was due to Youth A
attempting to use her bra to strangle herself. There were several
times where Youth A would turn the shower on herself, and staff
would turn the shower off. Staff 3 never heard or saw any staff
spray Youth A with water. The facility policy says if youth are self-
harming, staff must stop the youth from harming self which may
result in staff needing to use restraint techniques. If the youth is
not clothed and a restraint is necessary, staff cover the youth with
a sheet, so the youth is not exposed. Staff 3 reported when
opposite genders enter the unit, facility policy is for the opposite
gender staff to announce their presence on the unit. There are
never times where a male staff would be scheduled alone to work
a night shift on the female pod, there would either be another male
staff or a female staff.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on 2/15/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 is no longer
employed at the facility as he left there in October 2023. Staff 4
worked at Vassar House from December 2022 to May 2023. Staff
4 worked second shift which was 3pm-11pm. There was never a
time where he was working in a unit by himself, if he was working
a unit he always was with another staff. Due to him being a male
staff, he would never be alone, as it puts him in a situation, so he
always had another staff to maintain line of sight with him. He
worked on Youth A’s unit as a coordinator which meant covering
breaks, medication passing, and hourly checks on the unit. There
were times where Youth A was in the bathroom and staff would
have to go into the bathroom to ensure her safety as Youth A was
making self-harming statements. If Youth A started removing
clothing the male staff would leave and more female staff would
go into the bathroom. Staff 4 reported the only time he would go
in the bathroom would have been if Youth A was using the
bathroom and was not responding however never alone, there
would always be a female staff with him. He never went into the
bathroom alone and the bathroom stalls had curtains, not doors.
Staff 4 denied ever saying a statement to Youth A along the lines
of this is something we are not going to talk about. If a male enters
the female unit, males must announce themselves.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on 2/15/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 is no longer
6

employed at the facility. Staff 5 worked in Vassar House for
approximately three weeks, from the end of January to the middle
of February. Staff 5 worked in several units. Staff 5 did not
believe she had worked with Staff 1 or Staff 4 at Vassar House.
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone on 2/15/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 6 was present at least
three times when Youth A removed her clothing down to her bra
and underwear. Staff 6 could not recall exactly however believed
Staff 1 was present for one of the incidents when Youth A was in
her bra in underwear in the bathroom. Youth A had a
pattern/history of removing some of her clothing and go into the
bathroom and would climb on the stall walls. Staff would stay
there with Youth A and try to get her to come down. Youth A was
not near the showers, she was on the walls between the toilets.
Staff 6 never saw anyone spray Youth A with water. Staff 6 did
not recall any specific incidents where Staff 1 would have possibly
been there. If Youth A did not calm down in the bathroom, staff
would stay with Youth A and ensure she did not do anything to
harm herself. Staff 6 reported staff tried not to restrain Youth A
when she was naked. Staff 6 did not recall a time staff were in the
bathroom with Youth A and a restraint was attempted. Staff 6
never saw Staff 1 try to get a hold of Youth A where Staff 1 would
have grabbed Youth A’s underwear. Youth A had a pattern of
making statements that staff were hurting her and raping her even
when staff were not touching her. Staff 6 did not recall Youth A
ever say these statements about Staff 1. Staff 6 had no concerns
with how Staff 1 interacted with youth. Staff 6 worked with Staff 4
at the facility however they worked different shifts. Staff 6 was
unaware if Staff 4 ever worked a shift alone. Staff 6 reported
typically there would not only be a male staff scheduled alone, but
he has also never seen any staff scheduled alone. Staff 6 had no
concerns with how Staff 4 interacted with youth.
Staff 7 was interviewed via telephone on 2/16/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 7 reported the only
time he was present when Youth A unclothed was when Youth A
went into the circle hallway area and Administrator and another
female staff, unable to recall who, were addressing the situation
so he stayed out as Administrator advised Youth A was removing
her clothing. Staff 7 reported he did not recall any other times that
he would have been present when Youth A was not fully clothed.
Staff 7 never heard Youth A make any statements regarding Staff
1 sexually assaulted her. Staff 7 reported Youth A made
allegations against staff at various times while she was at the
facility including Staff 7 however Staff 7 was not near Youth A
7

when Youth A was making the statements and Administrator was
present with Staff 7. Staff 7 worked with Staff 4; Staff 7 was not
aware of any time where Staff 4 would have been working alone in
any units at the facility as he was a coordinator.
Administrator was interviewed via teams on 2/16/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Administrator reported she
did not recall being involved with Youth A in the bathroom when
Youth A was removing her clothes. Administrator reported she
was present when Youth A was removing clothing in the hallway
outside the unit however Staff 1 was not present that she recalls.
Administrator reported Staff 4 would have not been on the female
unit alone unless he gave another staff a break. Administrator
reported that would be the only situation she could think of that
Staff 4 would have been alone on the unit. Administrator reported
Youth A was yelling “they are raping me” during the situation in
the hallway when Administrator was present. Administrator had
all staff raise their arms in the air when Youth A was yelling “they
are raping me”. Administrator reported no staff were physically
touching Youth A when Youth A was making the statements “they
are raping me”.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 1/8/2024.
Complainant reported Youth A has a history of unclothing at the
facility. Complainant believes the incident occurred on 3/7/2023.
Documents Reviewed:
• Michigan Department of Health & Human Services Incident
Report 150540197 dated 3/7/2023 at 8:00am: Youth A
removed her shirt and was in a bra and shirt while the unit
was preparing to leave for school. Youth A went into the
bathroom and put the toilet paper roll in the toilet and used
the plunger to try to push it down the toilet. Youth A began
throwing water from the toilet all over the floor and was
yelling how staff could not touch her and how staff were
hurting her and raping her. Youth A began punching the
light cover to break it while standing on the bathroom stall
wall. Youth A then attempted to get to the outlet fixtures
and were blocked by staff. Youth A’s therapist was talking
to Youth A and Youth A was able to calm down and get
ready to go to school.
• Wolverine Human Services Therapeutic Crisis Intervention
Report dated 3/7/2023 at 8:00am is consistent with the
Michigan Department of Health & Human Services Incident
Report 150540197.
8

• A review of MiSACWIS incident reports involving restraints
with Youth A was completed. There were no restraints with
Youth A involving Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3. Youth A was
restrained on 3/7/2023 however a different situation in the
cafeteria and Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 were not involved.
• Staff Safety Plan for Staff 1 effective 1/19/2024-3/31/2024:
Staff 1 is not to be alone with any youth at any time. Staff 1
will not engage in any physical restraint unless she is the
only staff available and will remove herself as soon as
possible. If an occurrence requiring CPI to de-escalate or
physically manage arises, Staff 1 should be removed from
the situation as soon as possible.
• Wolverine Human Services Employee standards of
conduct: WHS Staff shall uphold legal and accepted
moral codes pertaining to professional conduct including
those imposed by the Department of Child Welfare
Licensing (DCWL). Any
Staff/Interns/Volunteers/Contractors who engage in
sexual abuse shall be prohibited from contact with
residents and shall be reported to law enforcement
agencies, unless the activity was clearly not criminal, and
to relevant licensing bodies.
• Wolverine Human Services Policy and Procedure for TCI in
Residential Programs: Non-violent physical restrictions are
never to be used as a form of punishment, discipline,
ensuring compliance, demonstrating authority, or
retaliation. They are only used to protect client or others
from unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior that
places them at serious threat of violence or injury if no
immediate intervention occurs.
• Wolverine Human Services PREA Policy: When staff of the
opposite gender enters the youth sleeping area and
bathroom areas of the house, they must announce their
presence. When a staff of the opposite gender is assigned
to work with the group staff must announce their presence
when entering a resident housing unit.
• Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4’s personnel file: There
was no disciplinary record for Staff 2. Staff 1 had an
employee counseling for a medication error on 11/21/2022.
Staff 3 had an employee counseling for parking her vehicle
on site on 12/4/2023. Staff 4 had an employee counseling
for proper supervision on 10/24/2023 and an employee
counseling for failure to report a suicide letter on 2/24/2023.
9

Staff 1 completed the required standards of conduct and
PREA training on 2/10/2023, Staff 2 on 2/9/2023, Staff 3 on
2/13/2023, and Staff 4 on 2/9/2023.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance based on interviews, it does not
appear that any inappropriate touching occurred between Youth A
and Staff 1 and Staff 4. It does not appear there was ever a
situation that matches Youth A’s account regarding the situation
involving Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3. It also does not appear Staff
4 ever worked a night shift as he was a second shift supervisor
and never worked any shifts alone.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
It is recommended the facility update Wolverine Human Services
Policy and Procedure for TCI in Residential Programs as the
policy also references CPI. It is recommended the facility address
in the policy how staff are to respond when a youth is not fully
clothed in restraints.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
